It's just another one of those extremely bad games that was released in 2016 on Steam. Shame on you, Valve.Rage Parking Simulator 2016 puts you behind the wheel of a car and you must park it. A pretty neat idea and certainly a fun game to play... if the controls would be even a tiny bit better.Here's the thing. To accelerate you need to press either W or up arrow key and to break either S or down. Normally these games would have the basic control scheme like any other game that has been on the market for as long as I remember but no, not this game. You steer your vehicle with your mouse. Yes, mouse. That's pretty awkward sounding and oh boy does it feel awkward.While the only thing that is horribly wrong with the game are the controls they do feel like they are the only reason why the game could even include the word "rage" in its title. If the controls would be fixed, or maybe changed since I can't really tell if they are intentionally bad, the game would be rather easy game to play. At least I would find the game too easy.So, I guess Rage Parking Simulator 2016 is another one of those games that is hard just because of poor design choices. It's not hard, just... rage inducing.

												I have played a lot of games, but this game really takes the cake.  Made in Unity Personal Edition (which, there is nothing wrong with that...a lot of video game greats are made in Unity...look at Cities Skylines!!), this game looks, feels, and sounds like it was made in under a day by someone who decided to download Unity on a whim.  I don't mean to be harsh, or in any way squash creativity by any means...but wow?  Had I purchased this from Steam and not a third-party, I would have already gotten a refund.Now...the breakdown.  Let's start with the controls.  Oh, science...the controls.  CONTROLSWell, for starters, you use the arrow key(s)...really only one (up) to accelerate.  I THINK down stops, but you can't really tell.  It helps ease my mind a bit to think that it does.  Now...the steering.  Since you use up/down arrows to accelerate and stop...you would think you use left/right arrows to steer, right?  Nope.  Definitely not, you have to awkwardly use your mouse (yes, if you are right-handed like me, you're using your LEFT hand on your arrow keys) to turn this little icon of a steering wheel on the bottom LEFT corner like it's some kind of mobile game and accepts touch-input.  TO RECAP: You use your LEFT hand to accelerate, your RIGHT hand to turn with an on-screen icon on the LEFT hand of the screen.  I...but...you...it...*sigh*.UI/MENUS/STUFFOk, the UI is...well...awful.  Almost worse than the control scheme.  You're greeted at the beginning of the game with a MASSIVE play button that kind of blends in...but sticks out...but is low-res and blurry.You can see a pause button at the top left of the screen, a steering wheel at the bottom left of the screen, and a "drive/reverse" panel beside the steering wheel.  If you crash, you are greeted by a "caution" triangle sign, with the word "gameover".  There are 2 buttons on this screen.  One looks like the Ohio State "O" with a left arrow coming out of it...presumably to go back...and the other is a "do-over" button, which is much more clearly labeled.If you complete the level, you are greeted by a "level complete" screen, which shows you how many stars you obtained, your score (which seems to be an overall counter of all the times you played the game, not that level...even remaining through multiple opens/closes of the game), and "coins"...no idea what these are for, where they come into play, or even how else to see how many you have OTHER THAN THIS SCREEN!The menu system is...weird.  You go back to the mission select screen, and you have 3 options there, "help", "leaderboard", and "settings".  The help screen brings up a small tutorial on how to play...the slider bar only goes halfway down though...not sure if there's more or if the slider is just broke.  The leaderboard is nothing more than the word "SCORE" with a cumulative score (just like in-game when passing a level) of ALL THE SCORES.  No breakdown, no way to determine how much you made per level, etc....just SCORE.  The settings is where it gets REALLY weird.  There's two options here.  "Sound" and "info".  Sound is a toggle which mutes...everything.  Not just the music, not just the in-game sounds.  Literally the sounds of the game.  Period.  All of them.  Info gives you the credits.SoundsI have to give some credit here.  Although the music sounds like a 70's erotic film or workplace training video and is blasting (headphone users beware); the car sounds aren't BAD.  They're far from good, but they're not bad.  When you turn, you can hear the turn signal, the car acceleration sounds are generic but solid.  The crash sound is abrupt and loud, but does the trick.Physics/CollisionThis is what ruins the game for me.  Completely.  This game is meant to be one of those frustrating, physics-based, pain in the tushy games where you get mad at your own fingers for betraying you.  If this was the case, I would leave it alone...but that's not the case.  First of all, hitboxes/colliders are BAD.  Not being a mobile game, and having very little art assets, may I suggest using a mesh collider as opposed to a box collider, so there is accuracy?  This will also allow you to use 3d art assets as opposed to just 2d sprites and may make some graphical things be cleared up a bit (if they're just a stain on the pavement or if they're a pylon/obstacle).  Some things you're not even touching yet, and you collide with them, others you can go halfway through before you collide.  This is literally the purpose of this game, this needs to be solid.  Here...take THIS IMAGE[images.akamai.steamusercontent.com] for example.  In what world is that winning, when the winning conditions are to have 4 tires inside of a parking spot without colliding with anything?!?!Anyway, here's the video of the gameplay...save your money and get a burger with a buddy or something, it will be a better use of your time and finances. My playtime: ~1.2h (based on steam, 100% achievements with no 3 stars on all levels ).Grindy Achievement: No.Optional Achievement: No.Difficult Achievement: No (depends on your patience, really).Developer Response: Never.IntroRage Parking Simulator 2016 is a "simulation" parking game. I said "simulation" because although it looks like a parking simulation, it doesn't feel like it. If you want to play this game to learn how to park, don't. Go play something else or just drive a real car instead.MusicThe music is okay for the game with this price.GraphicBoth UI and UX are terrible. I don't know how to close the menu. The help text is very small and it has a scroll bar. Fyi, the box containing the help box is way too small compared to the screen size, and the scroll bar can't be scrolled to the end. It's better to remove the scroll bar altogether and change the help text to somewhat readable. I bet the whole text will fit my screen.After you cleared a level, there is no button to go to the next level. You simply have to go back to level selection or replay the level.Although this game was made in 2016, the graphics look like an old game (and i think i recognize the images on one of the old games i played before).The gameYou have to park an automatic car to one of the designated spots. There are some spots to park your car into, and the difficult one will net you higher stars (maximum of 3). However, the controls are terrible. The gear starts in R gear (if you didn't know, it's the gear to move backwards) and there is no instruction on how to switch it to D (going forward). I ended up looking through the discussion thread just to find out that you have to click on the gear image in the bottom left to change the gear. It becomes worse as soon as you find out that you also have to drag the steering to left and right just to move the car to that position. The parking spot is also way too small compared to the "normal speed" of the car which will took you longer just to park the car. I'm sure that even if you can drive and park a car in the real world, you'll have to find a hard time to park it fast in this game.Pros:- None that i know of, except if you think that trading cards count as one, that is.Cons:- Terrible controls.- No "go to the next level" button.- No control tutorial.ConclusionThis is a terrible parking simulator which will make you rage.Should you buy this game?No.Seriously, it's not worth it. There are free games out there which is way better than this one. Don't waste your time playing this game.

												What the fudge is wrong with this game!?This game reminds me of the days when I was still learning to drive, when my father would always scream at me whenever I'm close into crashing the car.  The most frustrating part of learning to handle the wheel is the proper parking techniques, particularly parallel parking.  This game basically wants you to induce the rage by experiencing those frustrating moments, which the title heavily implies.  The problem here is that this is a video game, and being frustrated in a thing that's meant to make you relax and enjoy is the last thing that should happen.You complete a level by properly parking your car in one of the many slots in the carpark.  The more difficult the parking is the higher the score.  Through this mechanic another problem arises which is on how to complete the goal.  At one point I'm able to park the car but nothing happened.  The game didn't even tell that you're supposed to click on the star in order to complete the level.Adding to the frustration is the severe collision detection this game has.  Just a little touch to any of the present obstacles will spell game over for you.Here we have weird controls, where you use the mouse to control your steering wheel as well as shift gears, which only has Drive and Reverse.  Adding to the frustration is that the gear is set in reverse from the very start, so it's no surprising if your very first attempt at the game ends up with a game over.If you want to shave your hair then get this game.  You'll never need to go to a barber as you have pulled out all of your hair in frustration.

												So this is hands down the closest experience to real life parking I've ever had in any game that I played yet. Yep, honestly. And that is a honest, big PRO of this game, and it is also the reason I played it to the end. ..AND had fun while doing it. ;)I also learned how to handle a trailer (which I didn't know before), and I didn't even expect the game to teach me this, but it achieved it. Wow! :)But I admit, the controls not only feel complicated (but I almost expected this from a "simulator" like this), they are also deceiving to the extent that I would call it a bug. When you turn the wheel with the mouse (which is ok to me) you are actually not controlling the amount of steering, but instead the speed of turning the (real) wheel. So in effect, yes, the virtual steering wheel doesn't correspond to the state of the simulated steering wheel. And because letting go of the wheel causes the car to return to driving straight forward, this also means you cannot achieve wide curves without being either very fast (before the wheel keeps turning too much), or doing it slowly in very small steps (by resetting, turning, resetting, turning..). Any options for changing the controls are not available.There are also many obvious bugs, like that in level 19 I cannot get stars independent of how I perform, and in level 49 the camera view is locked to half the level, so you'd have to complete the rest blindly. ... Haha. ^^Also the goal position is not checked properly by the game, which causes you to win too early or by chance (which in fact is needed for some of the levels), or even constantly unintentionally winning a level at an easier finish when you were actually on your way for more stars (...XD). The stars themselfes are hiding your sight to the other cars, which causes you to blindly crash on some rare occasions, and driving with the trailer at acute angles leads to some physically strange movement of your car.So unfortunately, for these downsides (and some lack of polish here and there) I cannot recommend the game. Still, when you adapt to the controls, you will make it to the end. And perhaps, like me, feel surprisingly well remembered to what they told you in driving school. ;)Turning Circle Simulator: 4/10. Didn't fall into rage.
